ratings.comment: Perhaps THE BEST lecturer/TA I've seen on campus. The syllabus and course schedule look intimidating, but the course is well-paced. Even two submissions for assignments regarding the most difficult content (mid-semester). Lectures are dense, but digestible. Easily accessible outside the classroom. Great to talk, caring, and inspiring. Great guy!

Griffin was a stellar professor and overall a great guy. If you took stats in high school you will breeze through this course, and even if not Griffin will give you everything you need to truly understand everything. Super friendly, very knowledgeable, and he clearly cares about his students - highly recommend!

NEVER expected to get an A in this class. I am not great at math & was dreading my LS stats req, but I think Griffin knew none of us wanted to be there & tried to make it as easy as possible. I actually understood a lot of the material. There's a lot of homework, but you just have to do well on the data analysis projects.& Go to his office hours!!

Overall one of the best professors at UW. I am not good with math but he makes this course very easy to understand as long as you are keeping up with the textbook. He is very easy to communicate with and is a very flexible professor. I recommend this class to anyone that has a stats requirement

even if the content doesn't interest you, griffin is super accessible and caring that he makes the class bearable. he goes above and beyond to meet with students in office hours and provide regrading opportunities.

One of the best professors I've ever had. Genuinely cares about students wellbeing and wants them to learn. He's very supportive: accepts late work, gives excused absences, very understanding. Clear lectures in person (also recorded), solid rubric and fair grading. He's a great person. Lectures make a lot more sense if you've read the textbook.

Griffin is a great guy and a knowledgeable academic. He is also a great speaker and does a superb job in including the class during lectures. He is highly accessible outside of class and clearly puts in a lot of effort to ensure that students understand the content he is covering. He is a bit disorganized, but is a forgiving and easy grader.

I have never loved a professor more than Professor Bur. He truly cares about his students and puts in the effort to make sure his students understand material. I was extremely sick and was unable to turn into a project on time, and he was extremely understanding and flexible on giving an extension. I would for sure take another class with him!

Griffin is a wonderful instructor. I was nervous coming into Soc 365 because I had limited statistical knowledge coming into the class, but Griffin made the material engaging and was always happy to help. Also, he is very flexible with assignments; if you ask for an extension with good reason, he usually grants it as he values quality and health.

Had Griffin for both 365 and 360, and he was a great instructor. He clearly cares about communicating the material in the best/most efficient way possible, is deeply knowledgeable about what he teaches, and is super approachable and accommodating. Would absolutely recommend taking a class with him. His do files and slides are incredible resources!

Ive honestly never had a lecturer who has made it abundantly clear how much they care about students wellbeing outside of class as much as Griffin has. He teaches in a way that really helps you understand the material and uses interesting examples. Overall hes a really really great lecturer and teacher!
He's got great communication and I loved having him as professor and just a cool dude.

I have never actually filled one of these out before, but felt the need to for Griffin. First, in response to someone else saying slides are wordy - it is to accommodate those who cannot attend because he is incredibly inclusive. The material can get difficult, but he gives extra credit and a TON of support. One of the best instructors I have had!!
Griffin has a very deep understanding of the material and is able to explain it clearly and concisely. His slides are reference material which, when read, explain the material in-depth.

Griffin is easy to get a hold of and very willing to answer questions. However, I had to make sure to read all class materials before class. His lectures only made sense to me if I already had a solid understanding of the material. He often went more in depth than what is necessarily for hw and quizzes, and this stuff was quite confusing.

One of the worst professors I've had. Slides are extremely long, rambling, unclear and irrelevant to the homework and quizzes. Makes something that could have been explained in two sentences into 20 pages. Quiz questions are poorly worded and confusing. No clear "point." I've enjoyed both sociology and statistics in the past, so I'm disappointed.

Great instructor! He's very kind and approachable, and he's very helpful in office hours with papers and homework. He's enthusiastic about the subject material and helps to explain stats in a way that makes it easier to understand.
He is a very nice and well knowledgeable professor but with online classes you never actually had him teach. Discussions were lead by TAs and the prerecorded lectures were given by another professor.
